item.title: Ultimate Guide To Grid-Based Web Design
item.description: Noupe offers up a complete guide to techniques and tools for designing web layouts with grids. Includes basic information about grid design, links to more articles on specific aspects of grid-based design from other sites, links to all of the CSS grid-based layout frameworks I've heard of and a few that are new to me, and showcase of sites. Via @zakiwarfel http://www.noupe.com/design/ultimate-guide-to-grid-based-web-design.html

item.title: Making grids in Illustrator
item.description: font.is has an excellent tutorial for setting up grids in Adobe Illustrator using the Split Into Grid tool. http://font.is/?p=1226

item.title: Wireframe Sketch Book Now Available
item.description: The sketch book is finally available in the store. It's a small 8.25 x 5.5 inch wirebound book that lays flat, has a 24 x 24 grid with note block on the front (landscape orientation) and 48 x 24 grid on the back (landscape or portrait). Includes 50 perforated sheets (100 pages) printed in non-photo blue ink, and an interior flap on the back cover. For the first set sold, I'm also including a Zebra 0.

item.title: Photoshop and Illustrator Grid Templates
item.description: I moved the Photoshop and Illustrator templates for the Blueprint Grid System over from my personal blog at urlgreyhot to Konigi's Tools section. So now you can make the most of the system I use here and go from sketch to wireframe, to visual design comp. The complete tool kit now includes: printable graph paper graph paper notepads wireframe template Adobe Photoshop template Adobe Illlustrator template //konigi.com/tools/overview

item.title: Grid Designer: CSS grid generator
item.description: This is a cool browser-based CSS grid generator created by Rasmus Schultz of mindplay.dk. Lets you quickly set some column, gutter, and margin sizes using forms inputs or button controls. Similarly you can set typography with form controls, and the results are shown on screen. When you're happy, you can bookmark your work, and export the CSS. Sweet. Via @emenel http://grid.mindplay.dk

item.title: The Grid System
item.description: The ultimate resource on Grid Systems. You'll find links to articles, books, tools, and other resources related to grid systems here. Via Coudal. http://www.thegridsystem.org/

item.title: CSS Framework Roundup
item.description: Hidden Pixels recently rounded up the available CSS frameworks into a list. I happen to be evaluating CSS frameworks as well to find a flexible system to provide on a CMS I'm working on. The Hidden Pixels list isn't very descriptive of the specific usage or value each framework has to offer, so I've provided a summary of each to make this a useful reference when evaluating the list.

item.title: emastic CSS Framework
item.description: emastic is an interesting looking CSS Framework that is designed for both fixed and fluid layout. It looks like a nice alternative to fluid layouts than YUI Grids, with simpler and more flexible column structuring and class naming. * Lightweight (compressed weight less then 4kb) * Personalized width of the page in (em,px,%) * Use of fixed and fluid columns in the grid. * Elastic Layout with "em"s Blueprint is going to have to catch up and produce a version for fluid layouts.
